title: Ticket #5367: DAGMan tests fail randomly(?) on Windows
description:
Note: I'm making this a DAGMan ticket as opposed to a test ticket because it looks like there may actually be a problem with DAGMan on Windows, as opposed to just a problem with the tests.

Anyhow, we see DAGMan tests failing on Windows, but not the same tests reproducibly. Today job_dagman_maxpostscripts, job_dagman_submit_glob-A and job_dagman_submit_parse failed on the 8.5.1 release candidate. It looks like al of them timed out and were hard killed -- all of the dagman.out and run.out files just end in the middle of the test run.

Interestingly, all of the dagman.out files had messages like this: 

  11/04/15 11:21:11 attempt to connect to <128.104.103.11:48272> failed: connect errno = 10048.  Will keep trying for 10 total seconds (10 to go).

I'm not sure what that is, but I'm guessing that it's DAGMan trying to talk to the schedd to update its own ClassAd. (Just as a note, most of the dagman.out files did not have this error message; but some had the error message, but the test still succeeded.)

It also seems that all of the dagman.out files also have messages like this: 

  11/04/15 11:22:25 SharedPortEndpoint: failed to open ./shared_port_ad: No such file or directory
  11/04/15 11:22:25 SharedPortEndpoint: did not successfully find SharedPortServer address. Will retry in 60s.

I guess since all of the tests show these messages, they're not significant for the failures...
